node.title: WA to finally open its border on February 5 as Premier Mark McGowan reveals vaccination milestone
node.description: February 5 is the long-awaited date Western Australia will open its borders to the rest of the world, Premier Mark McGowan announces, as the state's vaccination rate reaches 80 per cent.
node.content:
["Western Australia will reopen its borders to the rest of the world\u00a0on February 5, almost two years after COVID-19 turned the state into an \"island within an island\".", "The long-awaited announcement by\u00a0WA Premier Mark McGowan came as the\u00a0state's vaccination rate for those aged 12 and over\u00a0reached 80\u00a0per cent.", "Mr McGowan had previously promised to set the reopening date once the 80 per cent milestone was reached, and has said that once the date is set, it would be locked in.", "The state government hopes\u00a090 per cent of the state's population aged 12 and over will be vaccinated by then.", "Once the state reopens, interstate travellers will need to provide proof of vaccination and return a negative PCR test within 72 hours of travel and undertake another test on arrival.", "International travellers will not need to quarantine if they have been vaccinated, but will need to test negative for the virus before departure and on arrival.", "Unvaccinated international travellers will still need to quarantine in a state-run facility for two weeks.", "As of Monday, WA was closed to all states and territories except Tasmania.", "More to come.", "", "
Why we hear about some COVID-19 variants more than others
"]
